property.name: guardExpression
property.value: isSync == True && isrIeee154eNewSlot_isPresent && cellType == CELLTYPE_ADV && ! dataToSend_isPresent

property.name: guardExpression
property.value: isSync == True && isrIeee154eNewSlot_isPresent && cellType == CELLTYPE_TXRX && dataToSend_isPresent

property.name: guardExpression
property.value: isSync == True && isrIeee154eNewSlot_isPresent && cellType == isSync == True && isrIeee154eNewSlot_isPresent && cellType == CELLTYPE_TX && dataToSend_isPresent && dataToSend_isPresent

property.name: guardExpression
property.value: isSync == True && isrIeee154eNewSlot_isPresent && cellType == CELLTYPE_TXRX && ! dataToSend_isPresent

property.name: annotation
property.value: here you set the frequency, load the packet, and turn on the radio (and you should also set the timer DURATION_tt2)

property.name: annotation
property.value: here you set the timer DURATION_tt3 and tell the radio to start transmitting

property.name: annotation
property.value: when receive a frame, you HAVE TO cancel timer tt3 and set timer DURATION_tt4

property.name: annotation
property.value: when the timer tt3 goes off, if nothing else happened

property.name: annotation
property.value: when timer tt4 goes off and you have't finished to send the packet-> ERROR

property.name: annotation
property.value: here you have to cancel timer tt4

property.name: annotation
property.value: if it is not synchronized anymore

property.name: text
property.value:
This state machine defines how the schedule looks like. For more information, see https://openwsn.atlassian.net/wiki/display/OW/Schedules
For now, the schedule according to OpenWSN implementation is hard-coded #define NUMADVSLOTS 1 #define NUMSHAREDTXRX 5 #define NUMSERIALRX 3
